DataElement.preferredName: Participant Personal Medical History Height Measure
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity.:A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual.  In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies._The vertical measurement or distance from the base to the top of an object; the vertical dimension of extension._The measurements for a given attribute.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity.:A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual.  In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies._The vertical measurement or distance from the base to the top of an object; the vertical dimension of extension.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity.:A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual.  In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

Concepts.definition: Someone who takes part in an activity.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

Property.preferredDefinition: The vertical measurement or distance from the base to the top of an object; the vertical dimension of extension.

Concepts.definition: The vertical measurement or distance from the base to the top of an object; the vertical dimension of extension.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8/9/12 - Released as part of caAERS v2.0 model cleanup.  jc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The measurements for a given attribute.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A measure of the 2-dimensional extent of the body surface (i.e., the skin). Body surface area (BSA) can be calculated by mathematical formula or from a chart that relates height to weight. BSA is often an important factor in dosing.

Concepts.definition: A measure of the 2-dimensional extent of the body surface (i.e., the skin).  Body surface area (BSA) can be calculated by mathematical formula or from a chart that relates height to weight.  BSA is often an important factor in dosing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Quantity; how much there is of something that you can measure.

Concepts.definition: How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified, used as a standard measurement of like kinds.

Concepts.definition: A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified, used as a standard measurement of like kinds.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: Move to caBIG context as teh preferred Rep class for Measurement

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/13/12 - Released as part of caAERS v2.0 model cleanup; VD associated with CS/CSI.  jc
